edu.utsa.mobbed

Class NumericStreams

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.utsa.mobbed.NumericStreams

  • public class NumericStreams
extends java.lang.Object
    Handler class for NUMERIC_STREAM table. This class contains functions to store, retrieve or delete records from NUMERIC_DATA table. The insertion and retrieval functions are designed to work in a multithreaded approach. For example, two separate thread are used for writing the data. One thread connects to the database and opens an InputStream connected to the table while another thread opens an OutputStream to write the data in binary to the InputStream provided by the previous thread. The retrieval process functions in the same manner.
    Author:
    Arif Hossain, Jeremy Cockfield, Kay Robbins

      • retrieveByPosition

        public double[][] retrieveByPosition(int startPosition,
                            int endPosition,
                            int elementCount)
                              throws MobbedException
        Retrieves data samples between a given position range. Creates a separate thread to retrieve data from database as binary. The current execution thread reads only the required data and put them in a 2Darray.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - start time for retrieval
        endPosition - end time for retrieval
        elementCount - total number of channels in this dataset
        Returns:
        A 2Darray of double values. Each row represents a single time point and each values is a sample from each element.
        Throws:
        MobbedException - if an error occurs

      • save

        public boolean save(double[][] values,
           double[] times,
           long signalPosition)
             throws MobbedException
        Saves an array of data samples to the database. Creates an DataInputStream to the database, which writes data in binary. A WriteBinaryData object is created to run on a separate thread to write data in binary.
        Parameters:
        values - 2Darray of doubles values. Each row represent samples from an element
        times - the times of the samples
        signalPosition - the position of samples
        Returns:
        true if the store was successful, false if otherwise
        Throws:
        MobbedException - if an error occurs

      • getArrayLength

        public static int getArrayLength(java.sql.Connection dbCon,
                 java.lang.String datadefUuid)
                          throws MobbedException
        Finds the length of each array in the numeric stream. The length is equal to the number of elements in the stream.
        Parameters:
        dbCon - a connection to the database
        datadefUuid - the UUID of the numeric stream data definition
        Returns:
        the length of each array in the numeric stream
        Throws:
        MobbedException - if an error occurs
